answers.answer: Our child was diagnosed with depression at six years of age (as well as severe anxiety) so six is not too young for this issue.  But, it is the end of the school year and I suspect that might have something to do with her behaviours.  Nonetheless, it would be best to contact your family doctor before the new school season begins as you have listed many behaviours common to depression.  If not depression, your daughter appears to require help in her social skills.  All the best ...

How old is your child now?  Is your child on any type of meds and if so what ? I am so scared of haveing my daughter on anything this young and to think she would need to be on it for the rest of her life.   What are some of the severe side effects you have noticed.  Thanks..

Our child is now a teenager.  She is on SSRI medication - but this is due to her severe anxiety (depression was only a behaviour of the anxiety).  Without her meds, she has no life.  She is now taking Celexa; there are no side effects that I have noticed.  If the medication is the correct dose and kinde for the disorder; there should be very few side effects.  After all, a child with diabetes takes insulin .....

question: My daughter has been very slugish for a while now and I've tried to encourage her to get involved in outdoor activities with the family as well as with her brothers and she refuses.  All she wants to do is lay around and then ends up falling asleep for a short period of time.  She seems to get plenty of sleep at night, however every night she complains of a headache and a stomach ace.  I have to remind her serveral times daily  of daily hygen habits, she could care less.  She will will get a burst of energy for a short period of time then crash again.  When asked about her day she can never tell me more than 1 thing I ask about friends and she says she has none.  I have spoke with her teachers and they all have said she seems to like to play alone or wants to hang by the teachers deak.  AnyOne Have Any Thoughts?
title: Does my 6 year old daughter have depression?
